text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the determination of whether the drunk driver's actions were an intervening cause is partially dependent on how long the chair was in the road prior to the swerving (to determine whether the drunk driver could reasonably have seen the chair in time to avoid it without swerving). The candidate answer analyzes the drunk driver's actions (D1) as a novus actus interveniens, focusing on the gross intoxication and the deliberate swerve into traffic, concluding causation is fully satisfied for D1 and broken for D2. It does not discuss the time the chair was present or the driver's ability to see it in time as a factor in assessing the reasonableness of the swerve, which is the specific element required by the criterion.", "criterion_id": "53430ddb-2da1-464a-af19-ff799ad6064e"}
